questions.question: Which UNESCO site in Italy is famous for its structured urban planning and is said to have been buried under volcanic ash in 79 AD?
questions.context: The ancient city of Pompeii is one of the most significant proofs of Roman civilization and provides an extraordinarily detailed insight into the everyday life of its inhabitants.

questions.question: Which ancient ruin in the Middle East, known for its towering ziggurat, was the ceremonial capital of the Achaemenid Empire?
questions.context: Founded by Darius I in 518 BC, Persepolis was the grand ceremonial complex of the Persian Empire, famously destroyed by Alexander the Great.

questions.question: Which museum in France houses the Mona Lisa and is one of the world's largest and most visited art museums?
questions.context: Initially a palace before becoming a museum in 1793, the Louvre's collection spans work from ancient civilizations to the mid-19th century.

questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel in the Middle East is known for its enormous height and spiral Minaret inspired design?
questions.context: Completed in 2010, the Burj Khalifa stands at 828 meters and is the tallest building in the world, symbolizing the engineering capabilities of the 21st century.

questions.question: Which capital city in Africa is known for its proximity to Robben Island, where Nelson Mandela was imprisoned for 18 years?
questions.context: Founded by the Dutch East India Company in 1652, Cape Town is a vibrant city famed not just for its history but also for Table Mountain and its natural beauty.
